required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of EPA-enriched Supplement in Malnourished Head and Neck Cancer Patients Undergone Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of EPA-enriched Supplement Compared With Standard Formula on Body Weight Changing in Malnourished Head and Neck Cancer Patients Undergone Surgery: A Randomized Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to study the effects of EPA-enriched supplement compared with conventional supplement in malnourished head and neck cancer patients undergone surgery. Primary outcome is perioperative weight changing.

detailed_description.textblock: To study the effects of EPA-enriched supplement compared with conventional supplement in malnourished head and neck cancer patients undergone surgery. The patients are divided into 2 groups receiving the different formula supplements. The both supplements are isocaloric. The patients receive the supplement for 3 weeks (1 week prior to surgery and 2 weeks post surgery) Primary outcome is perioperative weight changing. Secondary outcomes are body compositions, hospital stay days, complication and co-morbidity.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Body weight at 3 weeks
Change from baseline in Body weight at 1 month
Change from baseline in Body weight at 3 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in fat-free mass percentage at 3 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Percent of fat-free mass on the Bioelectrical Impedance Analysis (BIA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in fat-free mass percentage at 1 month
secondary_outcome.description: Percent of fat-free mass on the Bioelectrical Impedance Analysis (BIA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in fat-free mass percentage at 3 months
secondary_outcome.description: Percent of fat-free mass on the Bioelectrical Impedance Analysis (BIA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in body fat percentage at 3 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Percent of body fat on the Bioelectrical Impedance Analysis (BIA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in body fat percentage at 1 month
secondary_outcome.description: Percent of body fat on the Bioelectrical Impedance Analysis (BIA)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in body fat percentage at 3 months
secondary_outcome.description: Percent of body fat on the Bioelectrical Impedance Analysis (BIA)

arm_group.description: EPA-enriched supplement is given to the patients for 3 weeks (1 week prior to surgery and 2 weeks post surgery). The supplement composes of 2.2 gm of EPA and 630 kcal daily.
The standard formula supplement is given to the patients for 3 weeks (1 week prior to surgery and 2 weeks post surgery). The supplement is 630 kcal daily without EPA.

intervention.description: EPA-enriched supplement is given to the patients for 3 weeks (1 week prior to surgery and 2 weeks post surgery). The supplement composes of 2.2 gm of EPA and 630 kcal daily.
The standard formula supplement is given to the patients for 3 weeks (1 week prior to surgery and 2 weeks post surgery). The supplement is 630 kcal daily without EPA.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patients diagnosed as Head an Neck cancer with pathological confirmation
2. Receiving surgery as a primary treatment
3. Malnutrition screening tool(MST) is 2 or more
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Previously irradiated patient in the Head and Neck region
2. Previously receiving chemotherapy
3. Renal insufficiency with serum creatinine > 2.5 mg/dL
4. Liver function abnormality with total serum bilirubin > 3.0 mg/dL
5. Pregnancy

overall_official.affiliation: Faculty of Medicine, Prince of Songkla University
